item.description:
NOTE: This is a last-minute rescheduling of the 3/14 event that was cancelled because of the power outage; -- the concert's been rescheduled for this Friday night.  I only found out about this yesterday, so my apologies for the late posting.

Join us for another FREE classical music concert at the New England Conservatory of Music!

Friday night, Maestro Hugh Wolff takes the podium to conduct works by Charles Ives and Aaron Copland, including the famous Fanfare for the Common Man.  For more information on this concert, visit http://necmusic.edu/nec-philharmonia-wolff-0

Let's meet up at no later than 7:30pm, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert.  If the balcony is open, we usually end up sitting in left-middle section of it, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find, and it is relatively easy to grab a large block of seats there.  If the balcony is closed, I will try to have the group sit in the 1st two rows of seats at the back of the floor section, just past the overhang and in front of the black cloth-covered sound equipment.

Note: Due to Meetup's terrible decision to remove the Maybe option (write to Meetup here if you want to register your displeasure with that!), please indicate whether you are a Maybe in your Yes RSVP, and try to update your RSVP if you're not coming. 

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's near that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.

This evening's program will include:

  • Copland Fanfare for the Common Man   (listen here, if you're unfamiliar with it.)
  • Ives Three Places in New England, S.7  (listen here)
  • Copland Symphony No. 3   (listen to the first movement here)
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group upstairs in the left-middle balcony section if its open, or in the back center floor section if it's not.
item.name: RESCHEDULED: NEC Classical Spring Concert Series: Wolff conducts Copland & Ives
